intro: Dodonaea waitziana, commonly known as the silver dollar tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapindaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by distinctive, papery, winged fruits. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types. Dodonaea waitziana is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it suitable for coastal and arid regions.
